story.title: Sexy Claus - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Gia: Tonight I‚Äôm going to tell Neil I love him in a spectacular way!
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Chris Marie Green writes hot contemporary romance (like ‚ÄúBedroomies‚Äù!) plus urban fantasy. She also loves devouring pop culture and avoiding international incidents while traveling.

messages.text: Tonight I‚Äôm going to tell Neil I love him in a spectacular way!
üëè üëè üëè
How are you gonna do it?
Guess!
Will you tell him over a candlelit Christmas Eve dinner?
Nope. Think hotter‚Ä¶
Are you going to slip a sexy note into a stocking that‚Äôs hanging from his fireplace?
Wrong again. Go hotter‚Ä¶
I don‚Äôt know! Just tell me.
I‚Äôm giving him a Christmas present he‚Äôll never forget‚Ä¶
But you‚Äôll probably think my gift is crazy.
Honey, you‚Äôve been my crazy bestie ever since we were ten years old.
NOTHING you do could surprise me.
I want you to remember you said that.
Why?
Because I dressed up in skimpy lady Santa Claus lingerie‚Ä¶
Gift wrapped a big storage box and put it under Neil‚Äôs Christmas tree‚Ä¶
And then I climbed inside the box and closed the lid.
Now I‚Äôm waiting for him to open it and discover me inside üéâ üéâ
üòÆ üòÆ
Sexy Claus is comin‚Äô to town!!
OMG
And if you‚Äôre worried that I can‚Äôt breathe in here‚Ä¶
Don‚Äôt! I cut holes into the back of the box.
Besides, Neil is supposed to be here any minute, so I won‚Äôt be gift wrapped for long.
Haha, are you sure about this plan, you fabulous weirdo?
Yeah. I already texted him with instructions‚Ä¶
The minute he comes in the door, he‚Äôs supposed to open the big present I left under his tree.
He hasn‚Äôt responded yet, but üå∂ ü§∂ is waiting!
I‚Äôm actually warming up to this idea. You‚Äôre so giddy about it, haha.
Of course I am ‚Äî I‚Äôve been dying to tell him that he‚Äôs The One!
And I want to do it before his parents get here for the holidays.
Neil and I only have this ONE night together until I meet them for Christmas brunch tomorrow.
OMG!
What is it?
Neil just walked in!
Eeek! Good luck!!
Wait‚Ä¶
He‚Äôs talking to someone‚Ä¶
Oh my God‚Ä¶I think his parents are with him.
THEY WEREN‚ÄôT SUPPOSED TO BE HERE UNTIL MORNING!!
Oh no‚Ä¶
OMG, it sounds like Neil is walking toward the tree‚Ä¶
Noooo‚Ä¶is he going to open the box in front of them?!
Of course he is! I texted him to open me the minute he got home!
OMGOMGOMG
This CAN‚ÄôT be the first impression his parents have of me!
Text Neil again before he starts unwrapping!
A minute later
Okay, he hasn‚Äôt opened the box, and he‚Äôs still not answering my texts.
AND he went back over to his parents on the other side of the room.
His mom is criticizing the painting of a dog smoking a cigar that Neil has on his wall.
She‚Äôs saying it‚Äôs GAUCHE.
And *I* bought him that painting for his birthday!
Calm down, Gia.
Maybe you can just wait them out in your box until they take off for the night.
You said it had airholes, right?
It does, but they‚Äôre not leaving tonight!
They just thanked Neil for letting them stay in his guest room!!
CRUD.
Hold up ‚Äî Neil just said he left his phone in his car‚Ä¶
He just left the room!
That means I‚Äôm HERE ALONE WITH HIS PARENTS.
DRESSED IN LINGERIE!!
Wait, wait‚Ä¶maybe this is okay.
That means he DIDN‚ÄôT read your text about opening your gift immediately, right?
So maybe he‚Äôll go to his car, see all your texts‚Ä¶
And then he‚Äôll take his parents out of the apartment so you can escape!
Okay, good call. I‚Äôm texting him to do that right now!
Good. See? It‚Äôll be fine. Where are his parents now?
Oh no‚Ä¶they‚Äôre standing IN FRONT OF THE TREE.
OMG they‚Äôre talking about all the presents. I think they‚Äôre looking at them‚Ä¶
Please tell me you didn‚Äôt write anything sassy on your box‚Äôs gift label‚Ä¶
üòÅ
What does it say?
‚ÄúBaby, when you open this gift, you‚Äôre guaranteed to get a candy cane in your pants!‚Äù
Haha, did you draw the candy cane and everything?
Ysabel, focus! Think about how bad this is.
üò≥ üò≥ After his parents read that‚Ä¶they‚Äôll know you gave their son something hot for Christmas.
Exactly.
Maybe they won‚Äôt know it‚Äôs from you?
Are you kidding me? Who else would it be?
OMG they just read it‚Ä¶
And his mom is saying that I sound trashy.
Me‚Ä¶
Trashy.
Wait‚Ä¶am I trashy?
NO. Do not take this personally.
Too late ‚Äî of course I am. These are my boyfriend‚Äôs parents!
Gia?
Talk to me! Are you okay?
No.
His mom said it won‚Äôt be long until Neil gets tired of trash like me.
And his dad agreed! He said Neil will dump me sooner or later.
They hate me already, and they haven‚Äôt even met me.
Don‚Äôt listen to them. Neil really cares about you.
I can tell, just by the way he looks at you. Promise.
I swear he knows how lucky he is to have you.
I think I‚Äôm about to cry.
Don‚Äôt!
OMG, I just let out a big sob.
It was LOUD!
His mom is freaking out because she‚Äôs wondering what‚Äôs making noise inside this box‚Ä¶
She says if something is alive in here, she needs to give it air!
Gia is still furiously typing as the top of the box is yanked open.
She sucks in a horrified breath and squeezes her eyes shut.
The room goes silent.
Her heart pounds and severe embarrassment burns over her bared skin.
Finally, she opens her eyes to see Neil‚Äôs mom gaping down at her.
Neil‚Äôs distant voice cuts through the tension.
Mom! What‚Äôre you doing?
I thought I heard something in this box, Neil‚Ä¶and I was right!
Neil‚Äôs dad starts to lean forward, but Neil‚Äôs mom pushes him back.
Dominick, don‚Äôt look!
I can‚Äôt be in here. I need to take a walk.
Let‚Äôs go.
Moments later, the front door closes.
Then Neil looks inside the box.
With her throat tight, Gia holds back mortified tears.
Surprise?
Just so you know, this wasn‚Äôt how I pictured this going‚Ä¶
I can imagine. I mean, I saw this gift when I walked in.
I read the label and knew I needed to wait to open it‚Ä¶
But I had no idea you were inside, Gia.
He blows out a slow breath.
Did she just embarrass the hell out of him in front of his parents?
Maybe she really IS trashy after all.
Wishing she could just disappear, she struggles to get out of the box‚Ä¶
But Neil gently lifts her out.
And then he captures her mouth in a scorching kiss.
Moments later, when he finally speaks again, his voice is thick with desire.
I know this is probably the wrong time to say this‚Ä¶
But this is so unbelievably hot, Gia.
Gia lets out a shaky laugh and wipes her tears.
But then she remembers the look on his parents‚Äô face‚Ä¶
And her embarrassment blooms again.
Neil! This is a disaster.
I completely blew it with your parents.
She storms to his room, where she grabs her clothes from his bed.
He follows her inside.
Gia‚Ä¶
I need to go home, Neil.
I‚Äôm so embarrassed ‚Äî your parents basically just saw me naked!
No matter how hot you think this is, you must hate me right now.
He slowly turns her around so she can look into his dark brown eyes.
A tear wiggles down her cheek, and he wipes it away.
Wait a second ‚Äî do you think I‚ÄôM embarrassed?
Because of you?
YES!
I‚ÄôD be embarrassed of me!
Well I‚Äôm not.
How is that possible?
Neil smiles as he cradles her face with his hands, drying her tears.
Your gift was seriously so hot.
And it was clearly meant for me and nobody else.
Sure, but that doesn‚Äôt change the fact that I wanted to impress your parents tomorrow.
There‚Äôs no chance of that happening now‚Äî
They called me trash!
They‚Ä¶WHAT?
Neil‚Äôs jaw clenches.
When they get back, I‚Äôm going to have a talk with them.
They had NO right to do that.
You obviously aren‚Äôt trash.
Neil holds both of Gia‚Äôs hands earnestly.
I‚Äôm sorry about that.
And honestly, I don‚Äôt care what they said about you.
What?! I do!
Well my feelings for you aren‚Äôt going to change. No matter what.
Listen, my parents have been dreading the day they‚Äôd lose their only son to someone else.
So, on the way over here, after I announced how important you were to me‚Ä¶
And let‚Äôs just say the empty-nest syndrome really kicked in for them.
They weren‚Äôt ready to meet you at brunch, much less inside a box.
So I‚Äôll say it again.
You have no reason to be embarrassed. THEY do.
And I‚Äôm sorry I didn‚Äôt give you a heads up that their flight was coming in a day early.
Another tear rolls down Gia‚Äôs cheek. Neil dries this one, too.
Gia swallows, trying to process everything.
Did you say‚Ä¶something about your feelings for me‚Ä¶?
I sure did.
I didn‚Äôt plan on telling you like this, Gia, but‚Äî
God, I‚Äôm crazy in love with you.
SO crazy that a little bump in the road like this doesn‚Äôt matter.
My parents just need to get to know you.
Once they see how smart, fun, and caring you are‚Ä¶they‚Äôll love you, too.
You‚Ä¶LOVE me?
More and more every minute.
You‚Äôre my future, Gia. You‚Äôre‚Ä¶my everything.
Then Neil tenderly presses a kiss to Gia‚Äôs lips‚Ä¶
And her fears disappear.
Her world sparkles in festive colors.
And here I was going to tell you tonight that *I* love YOU.
I wanted to surprise you with the news while I was wearing this Sexy Claus outfit, but‚Ä¶
Talk about the best surprise ever.
But you know you have my attention no matter what, right?
Because all I want for Christmas is YOU.
With a rush of joy, Gia pulls Neil to her for their first official I-love-you kiss.
It‚Äôs the start of many more to come‚Ä¶
And the best gift either of them could‚Äôve ever hoped for.
